refnamediv.refpurpose: Function to divide vector z into complex and real elements, removing the one of each complex conjugate pair.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Calling Sequence
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: [zc, zr] = cplxreal (z, thresh) [zc, zr] = cplxreal (z) zc = cplxreal (z, thresh) zc = cplxreal (z)

listitem.para: vector containing the elements of z that have positive imaginary parts.
vector containing the elements of z that are real.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This is an Octave function. Every complex element of z is expected to have a complex-conjugate elsewhere in z. From the pair of complex-conjugates, the one with the negative imaginary part is removed. If the magnitude of the imaginary part of an element is less than the thresh, it is declared as real.
